metadata.title: CVE-2014-8142 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the process_nested_data function inext/standard/var_unserializer.re in PHP before 5.4.36, 5.5.x before 5.5.20,and 5.6.x before 5.6.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary codevia a crafted unserialize call that leverages improper handling ofduplicate keys within the serialized properties of an object, a differentvulnerability than CVE-2004-1019.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8142` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6

php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6

php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6

No subscription required

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.6').
